content: frankie s knitted stuff oblongs this is a very easy blanket to knit as it s just simple garter stitch squares it s only when you sew the squares together that it turns into … oblongs the idea for this blanket came from patchwork quilts - a never-ending source of inspiration the name oblongs brought back memories of early schooldays before i moved on to the more grown-up sounding rectangles yarn and needles the blanket is knitted with dk weight yarn the main colour m is sirdar snuggly dk 165 m / 50g shade 303 cream and the contrast c is king cole riot dk 294 m / 100g i used two colourways of this yarn shades 1951 caribbean and 1843 rainbow i knitted on 3 25 mm needles us size 3 and worked to a gauge of about 12 stitches and 24 row to 5 cm / 2 ² in garter stitch i used 400g of the contrast colours 200g in each shade and 250g of the main colour this allows about 40g for the cream borders the squares are about 12 5 cm / 5 ² and the finished blanket measures 95 cm / 37 ² knitting the squares using m and the long tail method cast on 30 stitches knit 10 row slipping the first stitch of every row knitwise after the first row change to c and knit 40 row if you knit into the back of the first stitch of the second row it will avoid that annoying colour blip showing through to the right side change back to m and knit 11 more row again knit into the back of the first stitch on the second row cast off knitwise darn in the ends keeping them away from the outside edges of the square as they ll get in the way there when it comes to sewing the squares together that s one square done the two cream strips at the top and bottom won t be exactly the same height as the cast on edge is a bit smaller than the cast off but this won t show when the squares are sewn together this basic formula for an oblong square can be used to adapt the pattern to different yarns adapting the pattern you can knit the squares in any weight of yarn using needles to suit the yarn and you can also knit different size squares to mine as long as you follow these steps cast on any multiple of six stitches double your number of stitches to give you the total number of row to be knitted in your square not counting the extra row on the top m strip divide the total row number by six to give the number of row to knit for the bottom m strip add one more row for the top strip knit
